Key Match Events: India won the first T20I against Bangladesh by seven wickets.
Varun Chakaravarthy made a successful comeback to the national side with three wickets.
Hardik Pandya scored an unbeaten 39 runs, including a match-finishing six.
Sanju Samson and Suryakumar Yadav contributed significantly with 29 runs each.
Arshdeep Singh took two crucial early wickets.
Mayank Yadav made his international debut, recording figures of one for 21.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Cricket Stadium, hosting its first international match.
Bangladesh struggled on a slow wicket, managing only 127 runs.
